items.title: Australia honours Bondi victims on National Day of Mourning
items.description: Australians have come together to honour the victims and survivors of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack.

items.title: Two women and man killed in shooting in NSW town, gunman at large
items.description: Three people have been shot dead in the Central West town of Lake Cargelligo, with the gunman still at large.

items.title: In Davos, European leaders met Trump with strength and he backed down
items.description: European leaders will be breathing a sigh of relief that the extraordinary threat of a US invasion of Greenland has receded. But some things cannot be undone.

items.title: PhD candidate working at CSIRO accused of planning Australia Day terror attack
items.description: Sepehr Saryazdi has been accused of planning to use Molotov cocktails and lead a "riot" at the Gold Coast on Australia Day.

items.title: 'I don't trust governments': Canavan unloads on hate-speech laws and Ley
items.description: Nationals senator Matt Canavan has questioned why anyone should trust any government when it comes to the powers over hate speech laws, and unloaded on Sussan Ley's leadership.

items.title: What's next, as Liberals and Nationals go their own way?
items.description: In the wake of the Coalition's divorce, there are few options for besieged Opposition Leader Sussan Ley, who must again reshuffle her cabinet and return to parliament with a diminished Opposition.

items.title: Oscar nods for Aussie actors Jacob Elordi and Rose Byrne
items.description: Vampire film Sinners broke the Academy Award record for nominations with 16, while Rose Byrne was recognised for If I had Legs I'd Kick You and Jacob Elordi got a nod for his role in Frankenstein.

items.title: Climate change made January heatwave five times more likely, study finds
items.description: A study by World Weather Attribution has analysed temperatures during the intense early January heatwave. It found that what was once a rare event is now happening far more often.

items.title: 'You have no idea what fair play is': Osaka and Cirstea in tense exchange
items.description: There is no love lost between Naomi Osaka and Sorana Cirstea after the Japanese star prevails in a hard-fought three-setter. Follow live.

items.title: Why would Trump want to build a 'Golden Dome' in Greenland?
items.description: Donald Trump wants a US "Golden Dome" missile defence system to be built in Greenland. This is what it involves and why some experts are skeptical of the plan.

items.title: March for Australia admins encouraged people to join White Australia Party
items.description: March for Australia organisers are planning a fresh round of mass demonstrations across the country on January 26, with members encouraging others to join the now disbanded White Australia Party.

items.title: Jerwin was 'exploited' while on a training visa. There are fears this is becoming widespread
items.description: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner has written to Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke asking for reform on the 407 training visa, following the inquest into the death of Jerwin Royupa.

items.title: Highways closed as multiple fires threaten southern WA
items.description: Hundreds of firefighters have been deployed to battle blazes threatening areas in southern WA.

items.title: What we know about a major landslide in the 'Gold Coast of New Zealand'
items.description: A young girl is among those missing after a landslide hit a popular campsite south-east of Auckland.

items.title: Cars plucked from ocean in astonishing flood recovery mission
items.description: Emergency services have conducted a dramatic salvage operation to recover more than a dozen vehicles from shoreline along Victoria's famous Great Ocean Road.

items.title: St Vincent's Hospital charged over 2024 death of Makalie Watts-Owen
items.description: Makalie Watts-Owen died by suicide while admitted to St Vincent's Hospital's mental health unit, a month before her 24th birthday.

items.title: From Bone Temple to Oscar hopefuls, here are January's best movies
items.description: Multiple Oscar hopefuls are finally hitting Australian shores this month, as well as the return of zombie franchise 28 Years Later.

items.title: Council evicts homeless people from riverfront camps
items.description: Mackay Regional Council tells rough sleepers evicted from riverfront camps to pack up and move within 24 hours.

items.title: Australian retiree's detention in Thailand a warning, lawyer says
items.description: Rights groups slam Thai authorities' detention and legal proceedings against Australian writer Murray Hunter, after Malaysia's communications regulator submitted a criminal defamation complaint.

items.title: Queensland man flies drone to second foreign fishing boat in Australian waters
items.description: A Torres Strait resident has flown a drone out to capture images of a second foreign fishing boat spotted in Australia's northern waters, just days after Australian Border Force officials intercepted a boat that almost reached the mainland.

items.title: Brisbane girls' school principal resigns following leaking scandal
items.description: A prestigious Brisbane girls' school principal will resign, following a scandal where personal student information was leaked to the public.

items.title: Financial advisor jailed for taking more than $1m from clients
items.description: Victims of a Perth financial adviser jailed for misappropriating more than a million dollars from investors say his six-year jail term is not enough.

items.title: Debt is America's Achilles heel in a fracturing world order
items.description: For decades, global investors have bought US government debt as a safe haven when things turn pear-shaped. But investor attitudes are changing, and America's financial domination is at stake.

items.title: Country town's citizen of the year to plead not guilty to child sex offences
items.description: A NSW court hears the former vice-president of a local show society intends to plead not guilty to dozens of historical child sexual assault charges if he is found fit to stand trial.

items.title: Woman found dead at K'gari a 'free spirit that couldn't be contained'
items.description: Friends of 19-year-old Canadian woman Piper James pay tribute to a woman who loved adventure and nature.
